newsitem.title: GERMANY: Sugar output from German harvest raised slightly.
newsitem.headline: Sugar output from German harvest raised slightly.

text.p: Sugar production from Germany's 1996/97 beet campaign stands at 4.17 million tonnes, white value, compared with 3.79 million tonnes in 1995/96, the sugar industry association WVZ said in a final campaign report on Monday.
It revised its early January output figure of 4.16 million which was issued when the campaign had just ended.
Other figures were unchanged from early January.
Beet deliveries in 1996/97 totalled 26.06 million tonnes versus 26.05 million a year earlier and average sugar content was 18.17 percent versus 16.73 percent a year earlier, WVZ confirmed.
The 1996/97 area was 516,452 hectares, up 0.5 percent from the 1995/96 campaign.
Beet yields of 50.7 tonnes/ha in 1996/97 compared with 50.3 in 1995/96.
